newsitem.title: BRAZIL: RESEARCH ALERT-Cosipa still a buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Cosipa still a buy.

text.p: Robert Fleming & Co Ltd said it has reiterated its buy recommendation on Brazilian steelmaker Cosipa although the stock's recent volatility is likely to continue until the release of third-quarter results.

-- In a report, Flemings analyst Raphael Biderman said the company's first-quarter 1997 results "looked like a strong improvement but actually has 31 million reais of non-operational earnings ligting otherwise poor results."
-- Cosipa posted a net profit of 28.4 million reais in the first quarter.
-- Biderman said that Cosipa may post non-operational losses in the second quarter due to a strike by dockworkers.
-- But he added: "As from third-quarter 1997 we should begin to see improvements driven by price increases and the start-up of cost-cutting projects."
-- Cosipa's preferred B shares were flat at 0.65 reais at 1454 local/1754 GMT in Sao Paulo.
